p:
The dried aerial parts of O. glandulosum Desf. when subjected to hydrodistillation, produced yellowish oil with a yield 1.73 ± 0.06%. These numbers were in agreement with the findings of Belhattab et al.
5 . Using GC-MS, a total of 32 compounds, representing 99.04% of the total oil content were identified (Table 1, Fig. 1A). The predominant compounds in the hydrodistilled oil were carvacrol (26.29%), γ-Terpinene (23.43%), Thymol (19.52%), p-cymene (11.67%) and α-Terpinene (3.02%). These findings suggest that the oil belongs to the thymol and /or carvacrol chemotype which is consistent with the findings from previous studies by Sari et al.
1 , Mechergui et al.
3 and Belhattab et al.
5 .
